HandAttachments¶

class Leap::Unity::Attachments::HandAttachments

An IHandModel object that has no graphics of its own, but which allows you to add transforms matched to points on the hand, fingertips, and arm.

To enable an attachment point, add an empty GameObject as a child of the object containing this script. Then drag the the child to the desired Transform slot. For example, to attach game objects to the palm, drag the child to the Palm slot. You can adjust the position rotation and scale of the child relative to the attachment point and the object will maintain its place relative to that point when the hand is live. Add other game objects, such as UI elements, primitives, meshes, etc. under the attachment point.

Attachment points are updated during the Unity Update loop.

Use with AttachmentControllers and Detectors to activate and deactivate attachments in response to hand poses.

Since
4.1.1

Public Functions

void OnDrawRuntimeGizmos(RuntimeGizmoDrawer gizmoDrawer)

Draws lines from elbow to wrist, wrist to palm, and normal to the palm.

Also draws the orthogonal basis vectors for the pinch and grab points.

override bool SupportsEditorPersistence()

Returns whether or not this hand model supports editor persistence.

This is false by default and must be opt-in by a developer making their own hand model script if they want editor persistence.

override void UpdateHand()

Updates the position and rotation for each non-null attachment transform.

Public Members

Transform Arm

The center of the forearm.

bool DrawHand

Whether to draw lines to visualize the hand.

Transform GrabPoint

The point midway between the finger tips.

Transform Index

The tip of the index finger.

Transform Middle

The tip of the middle finger.

Transform Palm

The palm of the hand.

Transform PinchPoint

The point midway between the thumb and index finger tips.

Transform Pinky

The tip of the pinky finger.

Transform Ring

The tip of the ring finger.

Transform Thumb

The tip of the thumb.
